name: recondense
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to condense (= change from a gas to a liquid or solid state) again for the second, third, etc. time, or to make something condense again: Steam from boiling water is recondensed and bottled to produce distilled water. When the vapour is cooled, it re-condenses as whisky.
More examplesFewer examplesThere were visible droplets of recondensed vapour on the glass.The chemical procedure of evaporating a liquid from one container and recondensing it into another container was first recorded in 8th-century China.There is a method of re-condensing the steam so that it can be reused.Water pulled from the rivers is circulated through tubes that re-condense steam that drives the electric generators.
